© A. Gómez Pérez, M.C. Suarez de Figueroa, B. Villazón,  E.Montiel, G. Aguado, M. Espinoza
31
Ontological Engineering
Life Cycle Models and  Life Cycles
•
An ontology life cycle model is the framework (waterfall, evolving 
prototyping, spiral, etc.), selected by each organization, on which to map 
the activities identified in the ontology development process.
•
The ontology life cycle is the specific sequence of activities that the 
ontology practitioners carry out for developing an ontology.
•
There is not a unique life cycle model
valid for all ontology 
development projects
Waterfall
speaker: SYSTEM
